page.title: 01Hamnish - East of Leominster
page.content: This block has no centres of population, but consists of scattered small farms, in gently undulating countryside. The large proportion of the area is grass-keep, for cattle and sheep; though a certain amount of the flatter land is cultivated. Though without villages or even hamlets, the area has been long inhabited as the iron-age fort at Bach-Camp testifies. Even St Dubricius' church (built in 1910) at Hamnish Clifford was built "in the middle of nowhere" to serve as a daughter church in the parish of kimbolton. The area contains two fine country houses, Hennor and Puddleston court, the latter now being used as a boarding school for 'special' children.
